bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 17, 1900

div1.p: Lawrence Reed describes a baseball game and gives news from the base. He asks his mother to ship a package to him.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 17, 1900
div1.p:
Although I have
been in the habit of writing
to you on Sunday - still if I
write today you will get it
at least two or three days earlier

Today is a perfect one
and this afternoon weas are
going to have a match game
of Base Ball between two
of the companies, and as
all of the officers and ladies
are going to turn out I
imagine we will have a
merry time- Gen Ewers and
his niece (Miss Garding) who
will soon be married to
my friend Humber, and Mrs
Van Vliet & 3 children arrived
yesterday on the McPherson
We all turned out on
our tug the Kearney &
met them up in the
harbor, took the band
with us and had a
lively time- I saw my
old Col. (Col Hasken of the
2 Arty-) he was taking the
trip for his health, he has
just recovered from a mild
attack of yellow fever.
I had a real nice chat
with him.

In my last letter I asked
you to send me a few things
for my room, if you do
so pay the express on them
to pier 22 Brooklyn & address
them in care of the Transportation
Q.M. & I will get them all.
Send them from Wash by Dec.
3rd so that they will
get on the boat leaving N.Y.
Dec. 7. as this is the last
boat we will have before Xmas.
I find Mrs Clark to be
a most charming lady- her
husband is my Capt and
I call there about twice
per week- I am also very
fond of Mrs Hayt. the Maj
wife she reminds me so
much of Mrs Orme.

Tell B I think she might
write to me, with best
love to all I am your
